website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty, hard-sided carrying case is good for keeping your crossbow secure when you travel.
pros: Good customer service from this company
cons: Check the dimensions carefully to make sure yours will fit before buying

customer_reviews.title: Good case for the $$.. needs minor adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Good case for the money.The two half’s don’t always line up when I close it. I zip tied the latches to the mounting posts because they kept falling off. I also glued the foam pieces into the case. Works good now with those minor adjustments! Update...After a few trips in the back of my truck I’ve noticed the with the half’s not closing properly, that allows dirt and water in. It’s not a lot, but wish it was made so that wouldn’t happen. Also had to customize the foam so the scope wouldn’t rub.
customer_reviews.author: Manvel Man

customer_reviews.title: the latches are cheap and tend to fall off easily at times
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son's Stryker 350. It doesn't close tightly because of the mounted scope on the xbow; the strap that holds the two sides is too long; the latches are cheap and tend to fall off easily at times, but not break and the foam pads fall out. After some minor adjustments like taking a heat gun to the top to make it close properly; shortening the strap; and glueing the foam pieces in place, it seems to be working out ok. In hindsight, we should have just taken his xbow to a store that sells this case to see how it fitted before purchasing this one ( which is a lot cheaper on Amazon.com).
customer_reviews.author: Papafio70

customer_reviews.title: Great case that fits my PSE Fang crossbow perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great case that fits my PSE Fang crossbow perfectly. The one complaint that I have is that the straps that hold the bow in place use a cam buckle system rather than a quick release or velcro, so you have to unthread the strap completely in order to get the bow out. Would be nice if it had a strap to hold the quiver as well.
customer_reviews.author: Beardking

customer_reviews.title: It will fit my Barnett Ghost 375 with a scope ...
customer_reviews.text: It will fit my Barnett Ghost 375 with a scope mounted (thanks for the answers to my question Cassia L. & Evelyn Cantrell). Having said that, it is a fairly snug fit, don't think I would want to check it as airline baggage - since the intended use of the case is storing it in a small apartment and transporting it by automobile, I don't think the airline baggage thing will be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Renner

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection, Great Durability, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my new crossbow. I love it. It keeps my crossbow protected. comes with the mounts for arrows, plenty of storage for any accessories. This is a must have to keep your crossbow as good as new all the time. protected
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, very large
customer_reviews.text: This case is very large and sturdy. The box it was delivered in was huge, approx 4'x5'. The interior foam is nice and supportive. My husband was disappointed that his bow did not fit in the case, as it's exactly what he wanted (our mis-measurement, not sellers) The return was very straightforward and quick. Be aware that the outside of the box has a photo of the contents in case your order is a gift.
customer_reviews.author: CooperDog

customer_reviews.title: For a new bow hunter
customer_reviews.text: This is a gift for my sweet grandson. Grandpa gave it a thumbs up so that means the quality is there.
customer_reviews.author: kathy patrick

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be beefed up.
customer_reviews.text: A little on the flimsy side. But usable. Would like to see more thickness in the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Day

customer_reviews.title: Good Fit For My TenPoint
customer_reviews.text: Fits my TenPoint Stealth SS crossbow perfectly. The only thing I wish they would do is secure the padding that the crossbow rests on so it doesn't pull out when you remove your bow. I ended up using so two-sided tape to keep the padding in the case and that seemed to do the truck. Besides that it's a good case.
customer_reviews.author: Allen B.

customer_reviews.title: Although the case itself is what I expected in terms ...
customer_reviews.text: Although the case itself is what I expected in terms of thickness - it simply does not close efficiently. I went on a trip from Newark, NJ to Montana and used zip ties as it would not stay completely closed. When I arrived - the TSA had obviously cut them off and several of my arrows were partially sticking out of the case. In the future I'll take anything loose or semi loose and put it in my suitcase and only put the cross bow in the case.
customer_reviews.author: William Langworthy

customer_reviews.title: Not for Carbon Express bows
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit Carbon Express bows. The case was OK it wasn't as stiff as I like my rifle cases but seemed like it would work if my bow actually fit it. If you have a Carbon Express I don't think there is a hard case out there made to work for it. Get a Carbon Express brand soft case. I don't like the idea of a soft case for my crossbow but it's better than nothing and actually fits it well.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Shipley

customer_reviews.title: Plano Crossbox Case
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be fairly well-made.....I've had it for a year now with no problems. Got it for a great price on Amazon. Holds my TenPoint crossbow securely. Just be aware that these cases, regardless of manufacturer, are big and bulky and fairly heavy......no much that one could do about that and still provide adequate protection for your crossbow
customer_reviews.author: LookN4ABargain

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt fit my new crossbow very well, ghost 420. should be larger in the scope area.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received my x bow case as promised. When I tried to place my Barnett Quad 400, it would not fit with the mounted scope nor does it fit properly into the foam inserts. It also did not come with the proper instruction manual. The manual provided was for a compound bow. The case is of excellent quality but my x bow does not fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Branch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent construction
customer_reviews.text: Wow ... sturdy , strong plastic at a fantastic price. Love this one so much i will buy another one for my compound bow and some for my rifles too The lid does open a bit too far but with a little adjustment of the lid strap . problem solved
customer_reviews.author: XX-MAN

customer_reviews.title: it's okay case
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to use it. Its the wrong sizes. And it would cost me alot more to ship it back them the case is worth. It being plano I thought the Quality would be a lot better than what it was kind of cheap made
customer_reviews.author: David Ziglar

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Need a cheap case to do the job? This is it. Will work for storing crossbows. Latches break easily and it doesn’t seal completely, has gaps. If you can afford it, spend more on a better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my tenpoint invader crossbow. It was a little big, but after adding a little extra foam padding it fits great. Even have room for a small broadhead box. Needs a couple extra clips to hold it together, but seems to be durable enough to protect my investment.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Fits PSE Fang LT
customer_reviews.text: 2019 January, received the case a week after ordering. Was concerned that it wouldn't fit a PSE Fang LT, it is a small crossbow, it still fit with correct pad placements that come with the case.
customer_reviews.author: Robb Hylton

customer_reviews.title: Ok case
customer_reviews.text: The case was ok. I had received a PSE Fang for Christmas. The crossbow fit for the most part. The case did hit the scope on the edge when closed. The biggest complaint I have is not enough form in side to keep the bow from moving around, no place to store part to keep them from moving around. I would add more foam which I did plus velcroed some small fishing lure container to the in side for storage. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan. Jones

customer_reviews.title: I wish it did because I love the way this case is made
customer_reviews.text: A VERY well made product....BUT....it was advertised to fit the Barnett Quad 400 and it does not do so. I wish it did because I love the way this case is made. Very strong and sturdy, with plenty of padding where needed. And also straps to hold your crossbow in place.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: a sturdy alternative!
customer_reviews.text: small amount of assembly req. good condition brand new// solid enough for the average super human abuse it looks as if it could take some very serious abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Harrell

customer_reviews.title: was a gift and they love it!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described, was a gift and they love it!
customer_reviews.author: deannak526

customer_reviews.title: Modification was needed to fit my Barnett Ghost 410. ...
customer_reviews.text: Modification was needed to fit my Barnett Ghost 410. A hot glue gun to change up where the foam was located and razor knife did the trick. I had to cut a couple little notches so my arrows would fit as well.
customer_reviews.author: Hookinembig

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not what it should be
customer_reviews.text: Case looked nice, packaging was falling apart on arrival and case was missing some important things that should of been Included including 1 of the straps to strap the bow down and 2 of the main pads that hold it from bang around
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Atwell

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all
customer_reviews.text: Glued in foam was detached since it was not glued very well. I figured my crossbow may even fit. It doesn't! The case seems well built (mold) but the foam is cheapy put in. Will not fit the Barnett Panzer V.
customer_reviews.author: Smooth

customer_reviews.title: Not all crossbow fit
customer_reviews.text: Crossbow didn't fit in case. Returned everything including instruction in the same box it came in. UPS back and only received 50% purchase price. Will never buy from them again!
customer_reviews.author: Bob OMALLEY

customer_reviews.title: Misfit
customer_reviews.text: My bow (Excalibur 380) did not fit properly completely assembled in the Plano Bow Max carrier. I will have to do some modifications tot he carrier to make it work or just use the carrier for storage. Double rifle carrier case idea came after purchase of the Bow Max.. Stardust
customer_reviews.author: stardust

customer_reviews.title: I had to cut slits into the foam to hold the 22" bolts but that was easy and they are secure
customer_reviews.text: The case fits my Ghost 410. Not a custom fit but it holds. I had to cut slits into the foam to hold the 22" bolts but that was easy and they are secure. Had to remove the quiver and strap it beside the bow. Still room in the case for cocking rope and other gear.
customer_reviews.author: JackD

customer_reviews.title: That it protects ALL of the crossbow, including the SCOPE! But it dont!
customer_reviews.text: It said on the list that my crossbow(carbon express) would Fit! It does. Except the scope hits when I close it. Even with The foam removed!?
customer_reviews.author: deborah peterson

customer_reviews.title: Cost versus quality
customer_reviews.text: The strap for maintaining an open box has too much stretch, which renders it useless for its intended purpose. The Horton 'Bushwacker" fit nicely in the box and the foam padding was adequate. Some adjustments were necessary, a sharp knife and some common sense were all that was necessary to complete the task. Securing more than four bolts within the case would have been nice. Along with a Velcro strap for securing a rope cocking aid. Cost versus quality...I'd purchase it again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Get's the job done with some caveats...
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done however the foam inserts supporting the butt and stock portions of my crossbow (Barnett Ghost 410) had to be removed for the case to close properly, with the foam left in the scope prevents the case from closing. In addition, the quiver had to be removed and set along side of the bow, Will not fit with quiver on.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R. Volans

customer_reviews.title: The strap to hold the lid open is useless. I'd say if you want to protect your ...
customer_reviews.text: Will not fit Barnett predator with Nikon bolt scope and sling. Had to remove and cut out the padding so it would shut. The xbow tied owns are cheap. The strap to hold the lid open is useless. I'd say if you want to protect your xbow and this the only option it will work. With my setup I'd never trust it to hold up to much heavy handling.
customer_reviews.author: Boiling water is for sure

customer_reviews.title: OK product
customer_reviews.text: What I like, it's a good looking design. What I don't like, it did not fit my Barnett ghost 410 crossbow properly. 1.The arrows holder cannot sit where it was design to be, meaning I have to relocate it or I won't be able to close the case. 2.The two straps that came with the case will not lock in place securely no matter how hard I pulled on them, so I bought and replaced thems with straps with welcrow and problem solved. 3.Not enough cushon where needed. My crossbow twist, turn, and slide inside when carying. Need more cushon especially around the scope area.
customer_reviews.author: 2ofakind

customer_reviews.title: great crossbow case
customer_reviews.text: this case fit tge crossbow perfectly. it keeps the bow secure. it's the perfect weight for transportation.
customer_reviews.author: love fun thrillers

customer_reviews.title: Won't fit Excalibur Vortex
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good case for the money. Unfortunately it's not wide enough for my Excalibur Vortex so I had to return it. The Excalibur website says that the "Plano 1133-00 Manta Cross Bow Case" will fit their bows.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Nearly fits the bowtech Stryker 380
customer_reviews.text: They are big just like other Plano bow max cases I like that the problem is the scope and the stock height when you close the case that's top to bottom Front to back same problem with the 380 don't know about other brands I bought 2 cases for2 380s was I surprised Will be ok for storage but not for shipping I will use a heat gun to make it fit Only for storage Make this a warning
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow Case
customer_reviews.text: It is a good case except that when I ordered my crossbow it was recommended and I can not close the case when the scope is on my bow so I have to take the scope off everytime I use the bow and want to put it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tman1948

customer_reviews.title: Barnett 400 with scope, not a great fit but it works, barely!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Barnett 400 with scope. Not a great fit but it works, barely! I would not have been pleased if I had paid normal retail.
customer_reviews.author: RJP

customer_reviews.title: Big case - holds everything
customer_reviews.text: The case was delivered on time and is everything we wanted. It is a huge case - so make sure you have place to store / carry it. No complaints so far; does a good job of storing the crossbow.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B. Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Knock out
customer_reviews.text: Best case I ever had. Tons of room. Strong as heck. Know matter how much you paid for your cross bow. It will look as good when you take it out of the case. As when you put it in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my fiance and he loves it. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Morales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great on my PSE with scope and some extra room for bolts
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. First had to glue the foam padding in then the bracket that holds the strap for the list is weak and just flops open and this is the worst part you can't have broadheads on your bolts they won't fit. Big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Daniel

customer_reviews.title: fits the crossbow it was purchased for.
customer_reviews.text: This fit my Dads cross bow perfectly and had additional room for arrows. My Father did say it was a little confusing to put together, but once it was he was very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Thomas

customer_reviews.title: little let down from plano
customer_reviews.text: Like the price but the handle design is poorly designed. There are times that the case does not always close properly either!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES P OROURKE

customer_reviews.title: and I am not really satisfied in quality of case
customer_reviews.text: Not thought out very well. I ordered two cross bows with case for them, and I am not really satisfied in quality of case., I tried to set up case with bow inside and you can not close same not to mention a massive crack in the CASE seem whether bow is inside or not. Looks warp, engineering just need to slow down and improve upon seem closures to make case close 100%.
customer_reviews.author: James Welch

customer_reviews.title: Plano Bow Max Crossbow Case
customer_reviews.text: The Plano Max Crossbow Case will take the Barnett Ghost 410, with and 3 arrow quiver attached (no arrows) or detach quiver with arrows and lay along side of scope and close lid. The latches will somtimes come off when open, snamp back in place and close. If you need to carry arrows below crossbow limbs in bottom compartment. You must modify with a dremal tool, as 22 inch bolts are to long and glue the foam pads in place. MF
customer_reviews.author: Monte Ford

customer_reviews.title: For the money this is a good case.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good case for the money and it does a goof job protecting my crossbow. I only have two suggestions next time put a higher quality snap system to hold the case shut and make it a little thicker. My quiver will not fit in the case with my bow.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Jacques

customer_reviews.title: This case is awesome! It's has a huge footprint but it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: This case is awesome! It's has a huge footprint but it's very nice. Lots of extra room inside for storing additional stuff. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C.

customer_reviews.title: Big Time Protection
customer_reviews.text: This case is HEAVY DUTY. Hard plastic shell and it comes with more than enough space to fit my bow. This has to be the best case on the market for crossbows. I would easily buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RRS

customer_reviews.title: pERFECT
customer_reviews.text: oNE OF THE ONLY HARD CASES i COULD FIND ANYWHERE. aND ITS A PERFECT FIT!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: mailing our bow without disassembly
customer_reviews.text: We have a big crossbow and were skeptical about if it would fit, it was perfect and mailed it like is ,just bought a lock.
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorsMomma

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: The case protects the crossbow and has the necessary room. The foam could be better or something else to protect the bow. I would recomend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Ten point crossbow fits perfect and room for extra gear and arrows, very happy with this case.
customer_reviews.author: diane hatlestad

customer_reviews.title: Case
customer_reviews.text: The hardcase worked good for holding the crossbow, the foam pads inside were not glued down very good so we had to reglue the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Winferd Doty

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sturdy and quality great. Husband thought great price for a great product. Recommend to other buyers that are looking for a case..
customer_reviews.author: sheshe

customer_reviews.title: not great but gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. Had some of the metal pins the hold the hinges together fall out but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: rmar

customer_reviews.title: Faulty latches
customer_reviews.text: One of the latches fell off as soon as I opened it
customer_reviews.author: TONTO

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: it's big and takes up a lot of room but does the job
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Galeno

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Case and the price is cheap compared to any other case I looked at.
customer_reviews.text: This case is all that I expected. My crossbow fits in it veery well and I can put the quiver in the case too. The slots for the arrows were a little tight but I can live with that. I could not put the Crossbow in the case with the quiver attached and I had to take the arrows out of the quiver to get it in the case with the Bow. All in all it is a very sturdy case and should protect my Crossbow very well.
customer_reviews.author: Keith McKim

customer_reviews.title: IT LEAKS!
customer_reviews.text: Um its leaks. Cannot believe I paid so much for something that cant keep water out.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Case
customer_reviews.text: Happy with case...just not as hard of a case as I expected... Have a wildcat C5 and have to take quiver off to fit in case... Room for quiver but not attached
customer_reviews.author: Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case, but does not fit Parker Challenger
customer_reviews.text: The case is beautiful. Huge, but beautiful. Unfortunately, my little crossbow does not fit. I have a Parker Challenger (a youth/ladies crossbow, and it is pink). I'm very sad that this case is too huge, as I want a hard shell case for my bow. My husband is happy because his recurve gets a shiny new case. I'd love to rate it higher than 3 stars, but is is useless for my intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: The Eatons

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is perfect for my Parker Buckbuster. It has a ton of room in it. It has slots to store your extra bolts as well as straps to keep your bow secure inside the case. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great case and an awsome company to do business with.
customer_reviews.author: tech

customer_reviews.title: Plano Crossbow Case
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY nice case and I was quite surprised on how well it is built when I received it. Has plenty of room in it and holds the crossbow firmly in place. Has an area inside the case for holding crossbow bolts and extra room for a small plastic carry case to put your odds and ends. I definitely recommend this case for anyone looking to protect their investment. I have a Horton TRT Ultra-Lite in this case and it fits in perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Maxtor

customer_reviews.title: terrible bow case
customer_reviews.text: terrible bow case, contacted plano, got NO response from them. that should tell everyone something. spend the extra money, and get a good case.
customer_reviews.author: kennethd.searlesjr.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, BUT Carbon Express X Force 400 won't fit
customer_reviews.text: Really nice case. But the Carbon Express X Force 400 WILL NOT FIT, The scope is too tall
customer_reviews.author: Doug H

customer_reviews.title: Really nice case
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice hard case. I have been torn between hard case or soft for my Barnett ghost 350. I finally saw the Plana Bow Max read a few reviews. What attract me the most, it was only $55 where most were around $80. I ordered it and it was at my door in 2 days, shorter than what they told me. Bow fits nice in case. you will have to take quiver off.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Plano crossbow case
customer_reviews.text: It's a great crossbow case for some crossbows. I have a Barnett Quad 400 and the lid won't close with the scope on it.
customer_reviews.author: 86JC

customer_reviews.title: Nice Case but doesn't do the Job
customer_reviews.text: My husband owns the Barnett Predator.....We bought this cause someone gave a review that it fit....There is no way that it will fit with the scope on and nevermind you can't put the quiver and arrows in it....Sent it back!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Great case but not recommended for Barnett quad 400. Scope stands to high. Impossible to afford to ship large items back for replacement. Be sure you have the right size before you order. Recommend buying the next size bigger in this design.
customer_reviews.author: terry turpin

customer_reviews.title: Quad 400 - buy one, scope it and put it in there... then relist the actual measurements for what would fit or not...
customer_reviews.text: the measurements given on the product fit my Quad 400 which was a major reason to buy it - however it doesn't fit as it should... and it doesn't support the bolts as advertised... it bends the fletching...
customer_reviews.author: tkeene12

customer_reviews.title: My crossbow scope touches the top which is not padded ...
customer_reviews.text: My crossbow scope touches the top which is not padded. The included strap that keeps the lid propped up does not hold and the lid falls completely opened . It's decent.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect crossbow case
customer_reviews.text: The case was everything I was expecting and the price was the the reason i purchased it. i have looked several the they were $140.00 and up. The delivery came right to the door and faster than what was stated. it also had easy tracking from the shipper. Very well worth the purchase and the bow fit perfect. Thanks Jim Reed
customer_reviews.author: James S Reed

customer_reviews.title: Husband had to reconfigure some foam on inside to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband had to reconfigure some foam on inside to make bow tight! Takes several locks to secure it for flying!
customer_reviews.author: Shari Milam

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: fits bow ok just a little bigger than I thought but I am satisfyed
customer_reviews.author: bob g

customer_reviews.title: doesnt fit all crossbows with scope attched
customer_reviews.text: description says it fits most crossbows with a scope attached. i have a barnett DOA and it does not fit with a scope attached. tried several of my friends crossbows and they too did not fit with a scope attached.
customer_reviews.author: jckennell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This case makes it very easy to arrange your items. Very good protection.
customer_reviews.author: Foxy Lady

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice crossbow case, but does not fit Carbon Express Intercept
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Dzurka

customer_reviews.title: WRONG DESCRIPTION
customer_reviews.text: Even though it clearly says in the description that it fits the Barrett Quad 400, it DOES NOT. To small, i am very frustrated, only reason I gave it 2 stars is because if it did fit it would be a decent case, also did not see a spot for my quiver.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Thomas Abshire

customer_reviews.title: The case itself is very nice but if you're shooting a recurve it won't fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Ad says it fits most modern crossbows. I have a 2014 Ten Points and the bow was too wide for the case. The case itself is very nice but if you're shooting a recurve it won't fit the case
customer_reviews.author: Ron Sims

customer_reviews.title: Crossbow with scope does not fit
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed and returned this item when I found that the Barnett Quad 400 does fit only without a scope mounted on it. When I mounted the scope the cover will not close. I returned the item and got full refund. Thanks to seller. I gave it 2 stars because of seller professional act.
customer_reviews.author: Mego

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good protection
customer_reviews.text: My new bow,a Barnett quad 400 does not fit in this case. Disappointed. Unable to find any hard case that will fit it without taking scope and quiver off. Had absolutely no problem with amazon in returning it. Impressed
customer_reviews.author: Silouetter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my crossbow as stated it would so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Majeski

customer_reviews.title: Plano crossbow case
customer_reviews.text: This is a much nicer case than I have seen for more money that fits my Tenpoint Titan Xtream a very good deal!
customer_reviews.author: pinedude

customer_reviews.title: Case is nice.. just not as hard sided as I ...
customer_reviews.text: Case is nice..just not as hard sided as I would hope. Works very well to store everything. The lid strap needs redesigned..I just removed it to lay the case flat.
customer_reviews.author: George W Owen III

customer_reviews.title: graet buy!
customer_reviews.text: A quality product well worth the money! Looking forward to my next purchase from them I feel better knowing it can protect my bow so well from Bing damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: Bow case
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as other cases I have found but for the price it is an excellent value. Holds extra bolts and Crossbow with scope fits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Hess

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product but wish it had a compartment for tools and broadheads .
customer_reviews.author: Daniel nadeau

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed with the latches or hinges. One of ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with the latches or hinges. One of the hinges was even broke when I received it in the mail. Also it was larger then I was expecting since I ordered it for a Barnett Rapture which is only 18 inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Scarborough

customer_reviews.title: Very good case, but one size does not fit all!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good case, but one size does not fit all. The TenPoint Titan Xtreme would not fit properly with the quiver attached. Adding an extra 1/2" of foam under the forearm cushion did the trick. Also, some xbows are more narrow than others. Extra, pre-cut foam to support the shorter limbs would make for a better more secure fit.
customer_reviews.author: DSM

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt fit Quad 400
customer_reviews.text: this is a great case and would have been perfect IF IT FIT! the listing says it fits a quad 400 and my husbands bow does not fit in this without removing the scope (which he is not going to do each time)....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you own a cross bow this case is a must have well built
customer_reviews.author: R H.

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite
customer_reviews.text: I have a Barnett Ghost 410 with scope and the case was not quite large enough to fully close, but I am able to get it latched with only a small gap in one area, so it works for me. Just wish it was a little larger.
customer_reviews.author: Guy A. Winohradsky

customer_reviews.title: way more than expected
customer_reviews.text: Really please with mine got it for $80 bucks. Could tell it was used but when I opened it someone forgot their last crossbow. Got a new barnett ghost recon 410 with new case for 80 bucks thanks for great deal.
customer_reviews.author: bbeason

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Could have been a bit taller. Have a tall scope and it takes some pressure to close it.
customer_reviews.author: JerryKeyes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy but could have had a little more information on what models this one fits.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Iglewski

customer_reviews.title: loved it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and it was nice hars and steardy case that is wayy more expensive in stores. And hard to find too. But i recommend this if you want a good protective case for your bow.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

product_meta.title: Plano Bow Max Crossbow Case, Black
product_meta.description:
The Bow-Max crossbow case uses Plano's patented PillarLock system to protect your crossbow. It also comes with high-density foam and poly tie-down straps to secure, cushion and protect your bow. You can store your bolts in the lid.

Following are models of crossbows that are known to fit the 113100 model crossbow.

Barnett 
Ghost 410 
BCXtreme Ultralite 
Razr 
Vengance 
Ghost 385 
Ghost 360 
Predator Ultralite 
Brotherhood 
Predator 
Penetrator 
Raptor FX 
Lady Raptor FX 
Quad 400 
Wildcat C5 
Recruit 
Jackal 

Ten Point-Foam modification required to fit some integral cocking tools. 
Venom 
Shadow Ultralite 
Vapor 
Venom 
Carbon Xtra CLS 
Carbon Fusion CLS 
Tactical XLT 
Stealth SS 
Turbo XLT II 
Titan Xtreme 

Stryker 
StrykeZone 380 
StrykeZone 350 

Wicked Ridge 
Invader 
Warrior HL 
Raider CLS 

Carbon Express 
SLS 
Maxima Hunter 

PSE-Some models with quiver arm will not fit. 
Toxic 

Parker 
Tornado F4 
Gale Force 
Hornet Extreme 
Thunderhawk 
Enforcer

AMAZON.COM
The Bow-Max Crossbow Case from Plano is designed to allow you to carry your bow with the quiver and scope attached in an airline-approved, secure case. High-density foam in combination with poly tie down straps ensure security for your bow and the lid holds bolts securely. Built for worry-free storage and transit, the case boasts thick wall construction and crush-resistant security with the patented, airline approved PillarLock System.

 



The Bow-Max Case holds the bow and quiver, and offers bolt storage in the lid. Features and Specifications: * Patented PillarLock protects crossbow 
 * Fits most of today's largest crossbows with scopes attached 
 * High-density foam 
 * Poly tie down straps 
 * Bolt storage in lid 
 * Quiver can stay attached to most bows
feature_bullets: Patented pillar Lock system protects crossbow
